info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 7:41AM PST until December 24 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Wind could gusts as high as 35 mph in exposed locations, especially in the Warner Mountains leading to some blowing and drifting snow and limited visibilities, at times. * WHERE...In Modoc County, California, portions of Highway 139 between Tionesta and Adin, portions of Highway 299 between Alturas and Cedar Pass, and Highway 395 north of Alturas. In Oregon, portions of Highway 97 from around Modoc Point northward to Gilchrist, and portions of Highway 140 between Dairy and Adel, including Lakeview. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of snowfall are expected. The first will be this morning. The second is expected mainly this evening through early Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
